p: All studies only enrolled overtly healthy male subjects without clinically relevant deviations of laboratory values, including renal and hepatic function parameters and hematology and of vital signs and ECG. Use of concomitant medication was not allowed except for single doses of ibuprofen and/or paracetamol. The included subjects were all Caucasians with a mean age of 33.8 years and a mean body mass index (BMI) of 24.7 kg/m 2. 496 subjects received treatment (370 active and 126 placebo treatments). The relation between active and placebo was similar (~ 3 : 1) in all studies. For details of treated subjects in different indications see Table 1.
